description.narrative: Race to the Top is a partnership programme, initiated in 2014 by multi-stakeholders, funders, development experts, international institutional efforts, international apparel and footwear companies, and with the Danish and Dutch governments as observers. The programme is managed by IDH, the Sustainable Trade Initiative, which is supported by DANIDA. The RTTT seeks to catalyse a `race to the top¿ by supporting and promoting sustainable growth in the Vietnamese apparel and footwear sector while optimizing its environmental and social performance. The sustainable change is to be achieved through systemic change and significant cooperation between stakeholders, public as well as private, while finding innovative solutions to current system failure. The RTTT stakeholder includes GAP, Levis, Nike, PUMA, Saitex a.o. and international development organisations as IFC, 3GF, and ILO/Better work. This project has supported a two days workshop in Hanoi in February 2016, including research and project formulation for all partners future activities.
